Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is purple and grey-black in section, both the interior and exterior are covered with a light-brown slip, the exterior bears traces of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394895) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394895)
